info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Otero County through 500 PM MDT... At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Silver Lake, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sacramento, Cloudcroft, Mayhill, Silver Lake, Weed, Sixteen Springs, James Canyon, Hay Canyon, Cox Canyon, Dry Canyon, Benson Ridge and Bluff Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
